byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

abstract: Interior and justice ministers for European Union members nations hold emergency meeting to address fact that people responsible for Paris terrorist attacks freely traveled into and out of Europe without being identified or checked; ministers agree to establish system to share passport data within open border area; many are concerned that agreements of that kind will lead to end of so-called Schengen Agreement, which established freedom of movement within union.
lead_paragraph: Officials met in an emergency session and vowed to complete French proposals for tighter controls by the end of the year.

headline.main: Paris Attacks Force European Union to Act on Border Controls
headline.print_headline: Attacks Push European Union to Consider Limits on Passport-Free Travel

snippet: Officials met in an emergency session and vowed to complete French proposals for tighter controls by the end of the year.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
